directional_pattern.pattern: MUTUAL_EXCLUSIONS_DOMINANT - Most failures are incompatible state pairs

FORMAL_HAZARD_STATEMENT: The Voynich control system explicitly prevents 5 classes of irrecoverable error, dominated by PHASE_ORDERING failures. The mutual exclusions dominant - most failures are incompatible state pairs directional pattern (asymmetry ratio 0.00) indicates state incompatibility awareness. Failures cluster in kernel_adjacent pattern, suggesting dangerous edge conditions around control points. This hazard model is consistent with expert-level operators managing reflux distillation where Vapor lock, premature condensation are the primary concerns.
KEY_FINDINGS: 17 forbidden transitions classified into 5 failure classes
Directional asymmetry ratio: 0.00 (MUTUAL_EXCLUSIONS_DOMINANT - Most failures are incompatible state pairs)
INTERPRETATION:
FAILURE-MODE TYPOLOGY INTERPRETATION

The Voynich control system encodes 5 classes of irrecoverable error:

  ENERGY_OVERSHOOT: 1 transitions
    Physical cause: Bumping, scorching, thermal shock

  PHASE_ORDERING: 7 transitions
    Physical cause: Vapor lock, premature condensation

  RATE_MISMATCH: 1 transitions
    Physical cause: Flooding, weeping, channeling

  COMPOSITION_JUMP: 4 transitions
    Physical cause: Contamination, impurity carryover

  CONTAINMENT_TIMING: 4 transitions
    Physical cause: Overflow, pressure failure

Dominant failure mode: PHASE_ORDERING
  (PHASE_ORDERING represents the primary safety concern)

Directional pattern: MUTUAL_EXCLUSIONS_DOMINANT - Most failures are incompatible state pairs
  (Asymmetry ratio: 0.00)

Spatial pattern: KERNEL_ADJACENT
  (Failures cluster at kernel boundaries - dangerous edge conditions around control points)

Physical coherence: HIGH

The forbidden transitions represent empirically-discovered 'don't do this' rules,
encoding practical knowledge of what leads to process failure in distillation.
This hazard model is consistent with a teaching system designed to
protect expert-level operators.
IMPLICATIONS: Forbidden transitions encode real operational hazards, not arbitrary rules
The system was designed by someone with practical distillation experience
Failure prevention is physics-based, matching known distillation problems
The hazard model serves as a teaching/warning system for operators
